text: 300px Two Women Bathing was a 1763 painting by Joseph-Marie Vien. A copy of it is now in the Musée de Cahors Henri-Martin in Cahors. The original was commissioned by Louis Philippe I, Duke of Orleans and first exhibited at the 1763 Salon. ==Sources== *Catalogue du musée de Cahors, La commission d’organisation du musée, 1883, p. 9-12, Lagrenée- Femme au bain. Category:1763 paintings Category:Bathing in art
title: Two Women Bathing
